org.mindswap.owl
Interface OWLOntology

All Superinterfaces:
OWLModel
All Known Implementing Classes:
OWLOntologyImpl
public interface OWLOntology
extends OWLModel

OWL ontologies may contain a set of OWL class, property, and individual axioms, and assertions about individuals. As such, it may not only represent a TBox but can also contain statements that fall into what is commonly defined as the ABox.

Field Detail

SYNTHETIC_ONT_PREFIX

static final java.lang.String SYNTHETIC_ONT_PREFIX
This prefix is used to create synthetic URIs for ontologies that were
  • not read from a (remote) file,
  • read from a input stream or reader whereby no base URI was provided at read time,
  • created ad hoc or derived from other ontologies.
I other words, the URI for synthetic named ontologies starts with this prefix.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getURI

java.net.URI getURI()
Physical or logical URI of this ontology depending on how it was loaded:
  1. URL if it was loaded from a file respectively a Web resource, or if it was loaded as an import of another ontology.
  2. Base URI if it was loaded from an input stream or a reader. In this case it may also be null if no URI was provided at load time.

Returns:
The URI that represents the name of this ontology. May be null as described above.

containsOntology

boolean containsOntology(java.net.URI ontURI)
Check if this model has had the given URI document loaded into it, which is the case, for instance, when this ontology was loaded and at that time an OWL.imports statement referring the URI existed.

Parameters:
ontURI - An ontology URI.
Returns:
true if the document corresponding to the URI has been successfully loaded into this ontology.

isReadOnly

boolean isReadOnly()
Check if this ontology is marked to not allow modifications. This property is transitive: imports of a read-only ontology (if any) are also read-only (and vice versa) provided that they were retrieved using getImports(boolean). However, this property is local regarding the backing KB: While it is reflected for this ontology in the KB, it is not for imports of this ontology. This is due to the fact that a imported ontology may be imported by another ontology as well and we decided not to globalize this property in this case.

Any attempt to modify a read-only ontology via one of the addXXX, createXXX, removeXXX, setXXX methods will result in a UnsupportedOperationException.

Note, however, that when a reasoner gets attached it can, of course, internally add deduced statements.

Returns:
true if this ontology cannot be modified.
See Also:
setReadOnly(boolean)

setReadOnly

void setReadOnly(boolean readOnly)
Allow or disallow modifications to this ontology. Setting this flag is transitive, i.e., spans over this ontology and its imports (if any).

Parameters:
readOnly - If true modifications cannot be made.
See Also:
isReadOnly()

getKB

OWLKnowledgeBase getKB()
Returns:
Reference to the backing knowledge base. Every ontology instance belongs to exactly one knowledge base.

getImports

java.util.Set<OWLOntology> getImports(boolean closure)
Get the set of ontologies imported into this ontology.

Parameters:
closure - Whether to return only those ontologies that are directly imported (false), or whether to return the transitive imports closure (true).
Returns:
The set of imported ontologies.

addImport

void addImport(OWLOntology ontology)
Import the given ontology to this ontology, that is, add all statements (as a sub model) to this model. Note that it wont be imported if (i) it is already imported or (ii) if one of the already imported ontologies (if any) imports the given ontology.

This will cause the associated inference engine (if any) to update, so this may be an expensive operation in some cases.

Parameters:
ontology - The ontology to import.

addImports

void addImports(java.util.Collection<OWLOntology> theImports)
Import the given ontologies to this ontology, that is, add all statements (as a sub model) of each ontology to this model. Note that an ontology o in the given collection wont be imported if (i) it is already imported or (ii) if one of the already imported ontologies (if any) imports o. Therefore, the order of the given collection may have an impact on which ontologies will actually be added as imports.

This will cause the associated inference engine (if any) to update, so this may be an expensive operation in some cases.

Parameters:
theImports - The ontologies to import.

removeImport

void removeImport(OWLOntology ontology)
Enforce that this model no longer imports the given ontology.

This will cause the associated inference engine (if any) to update, so this may be an expensive operation in some cases.

Parameters:
ontology - The ontology to remove as import.

removeImports

void removeImports(java.util.Set<OWLOntology> theImports)
Enforce that this model no longer imports the given ontologies.

This will cause the associated inference engine (if any) to update, so this may be an expensive operation in some cases.

Parameters:
theImports - The ontologies to remove as imports.

difference

OWLOntology difference(OWLOntology ont)
Create a new, independent, ontology containing all the statements in this ontology which are not in another. Neither of the ontologies is changed.

Note that the ontology returned does not belong to the KB of this ontology nor to the KB of the other, i.e., it belongs to a newly created one.

Parameters:
ont - The other ontology whose statements are to be excluded.
Returns:
A new ontology containing all the statements in this ontology that are not in the given ontology.

intersection

OWLOntology intersection(OWLOntology ont)
Create a new, independent, ontology containing all the statements which are in both this ontology and another. As ontologies are sets of statements, a statement contained in both ontologies will only appear once in the resulting model. Neither of the ontologies is changed.

Note that the ontology returned does not belong to the KB of this ontology nor to the KB of the other, i.e., it belongs to a newly created one.

Parameters:
ont - The other ontology.
Returns:
A new ontology containing all the statements that are in both ontologies.

union

OWLOntology union(OWLOntology ont)
Merge the contents of this ontology with ont and return the merged ontology. Neither of the ontologies is changed.

Note that the ontology returned does not belong to the KB of this ontology nor to the KB of the other, i.e., it belongs to a newly created one.

Parameters:
ont - The other ontology to merge.
Returns:
The union of this and the other ontology.

add

void add(OWLOntology ont)
Add all the statements of ont to this ontology. Note that this is not equivalent to importing another ontology, see addImport(OWLOntology).

Parameters:
ont - The ontology to add.

removeAll

void removeAll(boolean includingImports)
Remove all the statements from this ontology. This operation will also be reflected in the associated knowledge base.

Parameters:
includingImports - Whether to remove all statements from all imported ontologies as well.
